common.question: What's the difference between nullSlice and nullEDGE?
common.answer: nullSlice events are shorter, regional gatherings (4 hours, 6 sessions for session-based events, 90 minutes for networking). nullEDGE (October 2026) is our full-day flagship conference with 50+ sessions. Both are free and part of the same community.

common.question: Is this really free?
common.answer: Yes! All nullSlice and nullEDGE events are 100% free thanks to our sponsors. No hidden fees, no paid upgrades.

apac.question: Will there be recorded sessions?
apac.answer: This is a networking event without formal sessions, so there won't be recordings. For technical content, check out nullEDGE '26 or our 2025 recordings.

apac.question: Do I need to be from APAC to attend?
apac.answer: No! Anyone is welcome to join. The event is scheduled for APAC timezones, but we welcome participants from anywhere in the world who want to connect with the APAC community.

emea.question: Will sessions be recorded?
emea.answer: Yes! All sessions are recorded and published on YouTube after the event. You'll have permanent access to rewatch and share the content.

emea.question: Do I need to be from EMEA to attend?
emea.answer: No! Anyone is welcome to join. The event is scheduled for EMEA timezones and features EMEA-focused content, but we welcome participants from anywhere in the world.

emea.question: How do I submit a session proposal?
emea.answer: Our CFP opens January 26 and closes March 15, 2026. Visit our Speakers page for guidelines on what we're looking for and how to submit your proposal.

india.question: Will sessions be recorded?
india.answer: Yes! All sessions are recorded and published on YouTube after the event. You'll have permanent access to rewatch and share the content.

india.question: Do I need to be from India to attend?
india.answer: No! Anyone is welcome to join. The event is scheduled for IST and features India-focused content, but we welcome participants from anywhere in the world.

india.question: How do I submit a session proposal?
india.answer: Our CFP opens April 27 and closes July 5, 2026. Visit our Speakers page for guidelines on what we're looking for and how to submit your proposal.

india.question: Will there be certifications or CPE credits?
india.answer: nullSlice is a community learning event focused on practical knowledge sharing. While we don't offer formal certifications, you'll gain valuable insights and connections that can help advance your career.
